meta.name: Dangal
meta.description: Mahavir Singh Phogat, a former wrestler, decides to fulfill his dream of winning a gold medal for his country by training his daughters for the Commonwealth Games despite the existing social stigmas.

review.name: Omg what a great movie.
review.reviewBody: I watched this because my son wrestles and I didnt know it was a inspirational but also a tear jerker. Never heard of this movie until our wrestling community here in Ohio talked about it. Definitely one to watch!!

meta.keywords: small town,inspirational,father daughter relationship,based on true story,female protagonist

trailer.name: Official Trailer
trailer.description: Dangal revolves around the extraordinary life of Mahavir Singh, an ex-wrestler who is forced to give up his dreams of winning gold for India in international wrestling.

description.value: Dangal revolves around the extraordinary life of Mahavir Singh, an ex-wrestler who is forced to give up his dreams of winning gold for India in international wrestling.

plotText.plainText: Mahavir Singh Phogat, a former wrestler, decides to fulfill his dream of winning a gold medal for his country by training his daughters for the Commonwealth Games despite the existing social stigmas.

originalText.plaidHtml: I watched this because my son wrestles and I didnt know it was a inspirational but also a tear jerker. Never heard of this movie until our wrestling community here in Ohio talked about it. Definitely one to watch!!

titleText.text: Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India

originalTitleText.text: Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India

Suriya and Lijo Mol Jose in Jai Bhim (2021)
Ramcharan, Ram Charan, Ram Charan, Ramcharan, and Ram Charan in Bãhubali: The Beginning (2015)
Prateik Patil Babbar, Shraddha Kapoor, Tahir Raj Bhasin, Sushant Singh Rajput, Naveen Polishetty, Varun Sharma, Saharsh Kumar Shukla, and Tushar Pandey in Chhichhore (2019)

text.plaidHtml: The movie is a real life story based on Mahavir Singh Phogat who trained "dangal" to 6 girls, 4 of them were his very own while 2 were that of his brother. Interestingly, all of them won medals at some or the other level!

Teenage Babita is left-handed, which you can see from the way she claps during Geeta's Dangal matches. But she becomes right-handed when she gets older, which you can see from the way she claps during Geeta's Commonwealth games.

lines.text: You have to fight in a way that people will remember you. If you win silver, sooner or later, you will be forgotten. If you win gold, you will be an example, And examples are given, child... not forgotten. See those girls? If you win tomorrow, you will not win alone. Millions of girls like them will win along with you. It will be a victory for every girl who is considered inferior to boys; who is forced into household chores, who is married off to just raise children. Tomorrow's match is the most important one. Because tomorrow, we are not fighting just that Australian, but all those people who think lesser of girls.

comments.plaidHtml: Performed by: Sarwar Khan, Sartaz Khan Barna, Kheta Khan and Dayam Khan
